newsitem.title: USA: NBA BASKETBALL-SPURS' ROBINSON BREAKS FOOT, TO MISS SIX WEEKS.
newsitem.headline: NBA BASKETBALL-SPURS' ROBINSON BREAKS FOOT, TO MISS SIX WEEKS.

text.p: San Antonio Spurs star centre David Robinson, who missed the first 18 games of the season with back pain, was placed on the injured list Tuesday after suffering a broken left foot.
Robinson is expected to miss approximately six weeks and was scheduled to undergo surgery Friday to insert a screw into his fifth metatarsal.

The seven-time All-Star centre, who this year was voted one of the 50 greatest players in NBA history, suffered the injury during the fourth quarter of Monday's 90-79 home loss to the Miami Heat. He left the court and was taken for X-rays, which revealed a non-displaced fracture.
"It seems like I've been snake-bit all year," said Robinson following the game. "I could feel it when it happened and I was praying that it wasn't broken, but it was."

The 1995 NBA Most Valuable Player had led the Spurs to the best record in the Midwest Division the last two seasons. But San Antonio went 3-15 over the first 18 games without Robinson this season, leading to the firing of coach Bob Hill.
General Manager Gregg Popovich replaced Hill for the game in which Robinson returned and the team went 3-2 before Monday's matchup with the Heat.
Robinson, the team's leading scorer, rebounder and shot-blocker, had 18 points and six rebounds before leaving Monday's game injured.
The 31-year-old Robinson averaged 25 points, 12.2 rebounds and 3.4 blocks per game last season.
